title: ğŸ  The House Analogy Guide to Quarto & GitHub
text:
1 Preface
Welcome to ğŸ  The House Analogy Guide to Quarto & GitHub.
This guide will teach beginners how to:

set up Quarto
build a book project
connect it to GitHub
publish it online using GitHub Pages

We will use a simple house-building analogy to make each step clear and easy to remember.

title: 2Â  Chapter 1: ğŸ  The House Analogy
text:
Before we start building our Quarto book and publishing it online, itâ€™s helpful to understand the house analogy that will guide us through the process.
In this analogy:

ğŸ§± .qmd files are the bricks and rooms of your house (your bookâ€™s content).
ğŸ§° RStudio is the workshop where you prepare materials and edit the blueprint.
ğŸ—ï¸ Quarto is the civil engineer who constructs the house (your book).
ğŸŒ GitHub is the piece of land where you place your house so others can visit it.
ğŸš§ GitHub Pages is the public street where people can find and walk through your house online.
ğŸ“ The _quarto.yml file is your blueprint describing how your house should be built.
ğŸ› ï¸ The publish.yml file (in .github/workflows/) is a construction worker living on your land, who rebuilds the house whenever you make changes.

This analogy will help you understand each step in a friendly and visual way, even if you are completely new to Quarto or GitHub.

title: 3Â  Chapter 2: ğŸ§° Setting Up Your Workshop
text:
3.1 Step 1: ğŸ§± Install R (the building materials)
Before you can start building your Quarto house, you need to set up your workshop â€” the place where you will write your book, prepare your materials, and update your blueprint.
Just like a real house needs tools, we need a few digital tools too.
Hereâ€™s what we will install:
R provides the basic materials that Quarto can use for building your book.
â¡ï¸ Download R here:
https://cran.r-project.org/
Choose your operating system (Windows, macOS, Linux) and follow the installation instructions.

title: 3Â  Chapter 2: ğŸ§° Setting Up Your Workshop
text:
3.2 Step 2: ğŸ§° Install RStudio (your workshop)
RStudio is where you will spend most of your time writing your chapters and managing your project.
â¡ï¸ Download RStudio here:
https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/
Install it like a regular program (Next â†’ Next â†’ Finish).

title: 3Â  Chapter 2: ğŸ§° Setting Up Your Workshop
section: 3.3 Step 3: ğŸ—ï¸ Install Quarto (the civil engineer)
text:
3.3 Step 3: ğŸ—ï¸ Install Quarto (the civil engineer)
Quarto is the expert that knows how to build your book into a real website.
â¡ï¸ Download Quarto here:
https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/
After installation, you can check if it works by opening RStudio and typing this in the Console:
If everything is installed correctly, you will see a confirmation message.

Once you have installed R, RStudio, and Quarto, your workshop is fully set up and youâ€™re ready to start building the first walls of your house (your book chapters)!
In the next chapter, we will create the frame of your house by starting a new Quarto Book Project.
